intro: Pityphyllum antioquiense, commonly known as the Antioquian pittosporum, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Pittosporaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is adapted to the humid conditions of its native habitat. Its botanical features include a woody stem, lanceolate leaves, and small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its region.
